item.title: Friends and Neighbors, Thanksgiving is one of my favorite...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Friends and Neighbors,

Thanksgiving is one of my favorite holidays. I love cooking for days, eating for days and sharing love, laughs and thanks with my family and friends.

2020 has been a tough year. Many of us would give anything to be with our families today. To hug a loved one, to laugh with our cousins over a game of spades, to learn a new recipe from a beloved elder. But this year is different. It has to be.

...

The pandemic is raging through Colorado. One in 41 people are contagious with COVID right now.

So today, I'm staying put in Denver with my puppy, Clinton. I am missing precious family time to keep family members safe and to help our hospitals stay under capacity.

But still, there is much to be thankful for. First, I am thankful for all of you who are making this same sacrifice.

I also give thanks to:

- The healthcare professionals who are risking their lives to save lives everyday.

- The grocery store workers who are providing us with our daily essentials.

- The delivery drivers who make it much easier for us to stay home.

- The teachers and childcare providers who care for our children.

- The business owners and employees who are trying to make things work in these uncertain times.

I am also thinking of the many of you who are mourning the loss of a loved one. My heart is with you.

No matter the struggles, we are in this together.
